thread.title: Parliament shooting: Westminster Tube station closed, buses diverted and roads on lockdown after terror attack
thread.title_full: Parliament shooting: Westminster Tube station closed, buses diverted and roads on lockdown after terror attack

author: Mark Chandler
title: Parliament shooting: Westminster Tube station closed, buses diverted and roads on lockdown after terror attack

organizations.name: houses of parliament carl court/getty images  a

text:
Wednesday 22 March 2017 17:03 GMT Click to followThe Evening Standard Terror attack: The area around Parliament is on lockdown Victoria Jones/PA Wire 
Westminster Tube station has been closed and a string of London bus routes are on diversion after a terror attack at Parliament . 
A man was shot by police outside the Houses of Parliament on Wednesday afternoon moments after a car mowed down pedestrians on Westminster Bridge. 
At least one woman has been killed in the incident, which Scotland Yard confirmed was being treated as terror-related. 
All approaches to Parliament Square were closed off by police following the attack, with firearms officers still on the scene. 
The Met also urged the public to avoid Whitehall, Westminster Bridge and Lambeth Bridge. Attack: Emergency services at the scene (Stefan Rousseau/PA) 
Victoria Embankment and Victoria Street, towards Parliament Square, have also been shut. Westminster Attack: Eyewitness describes what he saw 
As rush hour approached, the only Tube station closed off due to the attack was Westminster. Attack at Parliament, March 22, 2017 Attack at Parliament, March 22, 2017 1/31 
A policeman points a gun at a man on the floor as emergency services attend the scene outside the Palace of Westminster, London Stefan Rousseau/PA 
Emergency services at the scene outside the Palace of Westminster Stefan Rousseau/PA 
A knife on the cobbles at the scene outside the Palace of Westminster, London Stefan Rousseau/PA 
The scene of the incident @Lukesteele4 5/31 
A member of the public is treated by emergency services near Westminster Bridge and the Houses of Parliament Carl Court/Getty Images
